title: Fix gallery image visibility by correcting static asset paths and adding fallbacks

requirements.summary: Ensure the Gallery references the exact deployable static asset paths for the 9 JPEG photos and that those files exist under the public assets directory used in production.
acceptanceCriteria: All 9 gallery thumbnails render (no broken/blank images) on the deployed site.
Clicking any gallery item opens the modal with the same image rendered at full size.
No gallery image URLs return 404s in the browser Network tab.
The Gallery section continues to show only the 9 uploaded JPEG photos (no older generated texture images appear).

requirements.summary: Add a visible per-image fallback UI for failed gallery image loads without breaking hover overlay or modal behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: If an image URL is invalid, the grid cell renders a clear fallback placeholder instead of an empty/blank area.
Valid images still render normally with the existing hover overlay and click-to-enlarge dialog behavior unchanged.

file_operations.description: Implement robust image load error handling for both the grid thumbnail and the modal view: when an image fails to load, render a neutral placeholder block with English text (e.g., "Image unavailable") while preserving the existing hover overlay structure and click-to-open modal behavior for valid images. (Uses existing shadcn-ui Dialog components—Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)

requirements.summary: Update deployment documentation to reflect rebuilding and redeploying after the gallery asset path fix so production is updated.
acceptanceCriteria: A new production deployment completes successfully.
After deployment, the live site shows the 9 photos in the Gallery section with no missing images.

file_operations.description: Expand the production build/redeploy instructions to explicitly include verifying the 9 JPEGs exist under frontend/public/assets/gallery, running a clean production build, and redeploying to ensure the updated static assets are included in the deployed bundle.
